headline.main: Supplies for Russia to Go From Boston to Archangel; Washington Rumors Say New Tokyo Regime Threatens to Block Pacific Shipments -- Distance Is Cut by Changed Route

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct 22 -- The Maritime Commission tonight announced that after next Tuesday all shipments of war materiel to Russia would go through the port of Boston, immediately reviving earlier rumors that the new Japanese Government of General Hideki Tojo had informed the United States that shipments to Vladivostok would be intercepted.
abstract: Maritime Comm announces all shipments to USSR will go from Boston to Archangel; ends shipping in U S vessels from Pacific Coast ports; RFC advances fund to Amtorg Trading Corp; Sec Jones comments; Shanghai and Japanese comment on abandoning Vladivostok route
